intro: Actinostemma lobatum f. longilobum, commonly known as the long-lobed actinostemma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often with a reddish or purplish tinge. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
